CVE-2024-40725: Source code disclosure vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server. Certain handlers like AddType could unintentionally expose local files to remote users.
CVE-2024-40898: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) in Apache mod_rewrite on Windows. Allows crafted URLs to trigger unwanted outbound requests.
CVE-2021-42013: Path traversal and Remote Code Execution in Apache 2.4.50/51. Attackers can access restricted files or execute arbitrary commands.
CVE-2021-41773: Path traversal in Apache 2.4.49. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files via crafted URLs.
CVE-2020-11984: Buffer overflow in Apache mod_md. Attackers may trigger memory corruption related to ACME certificate renewal.
CVE-2020-9490: Denial of Service in Apache HTTP/2 (mod_http2). Malicious requests can exhaust server resources.
CVE-2018-16843: Heap buffer overflow in nginx HTTP/2 implementation. Attackers can trigger crashes or DoS.
CVE-2018-16844: Stack buffer vulnerability in nginx HTTP/2, possibly leading to memory corruption.
CVE-2018-16845: NULL pointer dereference in nginx HTTP/2. Malformed requests can cause server crash.
CVE-2019-20372: Memory corruption in nginx. Crafted input could cause segmentation faults and DoS.
CVE-2019-11043: PHP-FPM remote code execution via crafted path. Extremely serious vulnerability allowing attackers to execute code on the server.
CVE-2022-31630: PHP buffer overflow in password hashing. Incorrect memory handling can lead to DoS or arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2022-37454: PHP hash table collision bug (XXH3). Certain input can lead to integer overflow or unexpected behavior.
CVE-2019-11041: Use-after-free in PHP EXIF metadata handling, may allow reading unintended memory.
CVE-2018-19935: Memory corruption in PHP PHAR processing. Crafted archives may trigger malicious behavior.
CVE-2021-29447: XXE (XML External Entity) vulnerability in WordPress Media Library. Can leak internal files.
CVE-2022-21661: SQL injection in WordPress WP_Query. Attackers may manipulate database queries.
CVE-2022-21664: Object injection vulnerability in WordPress. Untrusted input may lead to unintended code execution.
CVE-2022-21662: WordPress core vulnerability related to REST API handling. Insufficient sanitization may leak sensitive data.
CVE-2012-2378: Apache CXF 2.4.5 through 2.4.7, 2.5.1 through 2.5.3, and 2.6.x before 2.6.1, does not properly enforce child policies of a WS-SecurityPolicy 1.1 SupportingToken policy on the client side, which allows remote attackers to bypass the (1) AlgorithmSuite, (2) SignedParts, (3) SignedElements, (4) EncryptedParts, and (5) EncryptedElements policies.
CVE-2016-6814: When an application with unsupported Codehaus versions of Groovy from 1.7.0 to 2.4.3, Apache Groovy 2.4.4 to 2.4.7 on classpath uses standard Java serialization mechanisms, e.g. to communicate between servers or to store local data, it was possible for an attacker to bake a special serialized object that will execute code directly when deserialized. All applications which rely on serialization and do not isolate the code which deserializes objects were subject to this vulnerability.
CVE-2021-44224: A crafted URI sent to httpd configured as a forward proxy (ProxyRequests on) can cause a crash (NULL pointer dereference) or, for configurations mixing forward and reverse proxy declarations, can allow for requests to be directed to a declared Unix Domain Socket endpoint (Server Side Request Forgery). This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.7 up to 2.4.51 (included).
